Module it.polimi.ingsw.am52
Package it.polimi.ingsw.am52.model.cards

Class KingdomCardFace

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.am52.model.cards.CardFace
it.polimi.ingsw.am52.model.cards.KingdomCardFace
All Implemented Interfaces:
ItemsProvider, Pluggable, ResourcesProvider
Direct Known Subclasses:
GoldFrontFace, KingdomBackFace, ResourceFrontFace
public abstract class KingdomCardFace extends CardFace implements ItemsProvider
The base class for all kingdom cards (Gold and Resource cards). These cards have an associated kingdom, and they can participate in the creation of the target patterns when placed on the playing board. This class defines the method to check if the card can be placed on the playing board and to calculate the point eventually gained by the player when the card is placed.

  • Method Details

    • getKingdom

      public abstract Kingdom getKingdom()
      All kingdom card (Gold and Resource cards) has an associated kingdom.
      Returns:
      The kingdom of the card.

    • gainedPoints

      public int gainedPoints(ItemsProvider items, int linkedCorners)
      Calculates the points gained by the player, when the card face is placed on the playing board. The number of points can be a fixed number, or depend on the items visible on the playing board, or linked corners of the placed card.
      Parameters:
      items - The visible items on the playing board (after the card is placed).
      linkedCorners - The corners linked to the placed card.
      Returns:
      The number of points gained by the player when the cad is placed on the playing board.

    • canPlace

      public boolean canPlace(ResourcesProvider availableResources)
      Check if available resources (from the playing board) are enough to fulfill the resources required by this card face.

      The default implementation always return true. If a subclass has different behavior, it must override this method.

      Parameters:
      availableResources - The available resources (from the playing board).
      Returns:
      True if the card can be placed, false otherwise.

    • getPoints

      public String getPoints()
      Method used by the User Interface to print the useful information about the points gained by the placement of the card.
      Returns:
      The string with the necessary information about the points of the face of the card.

    • getItems

      public ItemsCounter getItems()
      The items visible on all card face corners.

      Returns:
